sentence.Network_en: The young minstrel had a rare, rich voice.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个青年歌手有一幅稀有的嘹亮嗓音.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French menestral 'entertainer, servant', via Provençal from late Latin ministerialis 'servant' (see ministerial)

entry.tran: (中世纪云游各地为贵族表演的)吟游歌手，吟游乐师
entry.def: In medieval times, a minstrel was a singer and musician who travelled around and entertained noble families.
